title: Indian Independence Act receives Royal Assent
description: The British Parliament’s Indian Independence Act 1947 received Royal Assent, paving the way for the creation of India and Pakistan.

title: India becomes a sovereign nation
description: At midnight, India became independent; Jawaharlal Nehru delivered the 'Tryst with Destiny' speech.

title: Republic of India established
description: The Constitution of India came into effect; India became a republic and Dr. Rajendra Prasad became the first President.

title: First general elections of independent India begin
description: India held its first general elections over several months with massive voter participation.

title: Sputnik 1 launched
description: The Soviet Union launched Sputnik 1, beginning the Space Age.

title: Apollo 11 Moon landing
description: Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin landed on the Moon during Apollo 11; Armstrong became the first human to step on the lunar surface.

title: Bangladesh Liberation War ends
description: Pakistani forces surrendered in Dhaka, leading to the creation of Bangladesh.

title: Emergency declared in India
description: The President of India declared a state of Emergency on the advice of Prime Minister Indira Gandhi.

title: Jana Gana Mana adopted as national anthem of India
description: India officially adopted 'Jana Gana Mana' as its national anthem.

title: Berlin Wall falls
description: East German authorities allowed citizens to cross into West Berlin, leading to the fall of the Berlin Wall.

title: World Wide Web proposed
description: Tim Berners-Lee proposed a distributed hypertext system at CERN that became the World Wide Web.

title: World Wide Web goes public
description: CERN announced the World Wide Web would be available royalty-free to anyone, catalyzing the modern internet.

title: NATO air campaign in Kosovo begins
description: NATO launched air strikes against Yugoslavia during the Kosovo War.

title: Euro currency introduced (non-cash)
description: The euro was introduced as an accounting currency in 11 EU countries.

title: 9/11 attacks
description: Terrorist attacks in the United States destroyed the World Trade Center towers and damaged the Pentagon.

title: Human Genome Project draft announced
description: Scientists announced a working draft sequence of the human genome.

title: Facebook launches
description: Mark Zuckerberg launched TheFacebook at Harvard, which later became Facebook.

title: Indian Ocean tsunami
description: A massive undersea earthquake off Sumatra triggered a tsunami that devastated countries around the Indian Ocean.

title: YouTube founded
description: YouTube was founded by former PayPal employees, becoming the leading video-sharing platform.

title: Twitter launched
description: The microblogging service Twitter launched to the public.

title: Global financial crisis peaks (Lehman Brothers files for bankruptcy)
description: Lehman Brothers filed for bankruptcy protection, intensifying the 2008 global financial crisis.

title: Barack Obama elected President of the United States
description: Barack Obama won the 2008 U.S. presidential election.

title: Osama bin Laden killed
description: U.S. Navy SEALs killed Osama bin Laden in Abbottabad, Pakistan.

title: Arab Spring begins (Tunisian Revolution)
description: Protests in Tunisia sparked a wave of uprisings across the Arab world.

title: India wins 2011 Cricket World Cup
description: India defeated Sri Lanka in Mumbai to win the ICC Cricket World Cup.

title: COVID-19 declared a pandemic by WHO
description: The World Health Organization declared COVID-19 a global pandemic.

title: Chandrayaan-3 soft-lands near the Moon’s south pole
description: ISRO’s Chandrayaan-3 achieved a successful soft landing near the lunar south pole, making India the first to reach this region.

title: Article 370 abrogated in India
description: The Government of India abrogated Article 370, revoking Jammu & Kashmir’s special status.

title: Demonetisation in India announced
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced the demonetisation of ₹500 and ₹1000 banknotes.

title: Paris Agreement adopted
description: Nearly every nation adopted the Paris Agreement to combat climate change.

title: Mars Orbiter Mission (Mangalyaan) successfully enters Mars orbit
description: ISRO’s Mangalyaan became the first Asian mission to reach Martian orbit on its first attempt.

title: Brexit referendum
description: The United Kingdom voted to leave the European Union.

title: GST launched in India
description: India rolled out the Goods and Services Tax, the biggest indirect tax reform.

title: Aadhaar becomes world’s largest biometric ID program
description: Aadhaar enrollment crossed 1 billion residents, making it the largest biometric ID system.

title: First modern Olympic Games open in Athens
description: The first modern Olympics opened at the Panathenaic Stadium.

title: First World War begins (Austria-Hungary declares war on Serbia)
description: Austro-Hungarian declaration on Serbia triggered wider alliances, beginning World War I.

title: United Nations founded
description: The UN Charter came into force and the United Nations was officially established.

title: Mahatma Gandhi assassinated
description: Mahatma Gandhi was assassinated in New Delhi by Nathuram Godse.

title: Green Revolution expands in India (High-yield seeds introduced widely)
description: The Green Revolution spread in late 1960s; 1966–68 saw large-scale HYV adoption and fertilizer use.

title: Treaty of Versailles signed
description: Formally ended the state of war between Germany and the Allied Powers after World War I.

title: Pearl Harbor attacked
description: Japan attacked the U.S. Pacific Fleet at Pearl Harbor, bringing the U.S. into World War II.

title: D-Day landings
description: Allied forces landed in Normandy, France, opening a Western front against Nazi Germany.

title: Nuclear Non-Proliferation Treaty opens for signature
description: The NPT opened for signatures to prevent the spread of nuclear weapons.

title: Partition of Bengal announced (1905)
description: The Partition of Bengal was announced by Viceroy Curzon, later annulled in 1911 after widespread protest.

title: Jallianwala Bagh massacre
description: British troops under General Dyer fired on a peaceful crowd in Amritsar, killing hundreds.

title: First successful powered airplane flight
description: The Wright brothers achieved the first controlled, sustained flight of a powered aircraft at Kitty Hawk.

title: Pluto discovered
description: Clyde Tombaugh discovered Pluto at Lowell Observatory.

title: Indian Constitution adopted by the Constituent Assembly
description: The Constituent Assembly adopted the Constitution of India (to come into effect on 26 Jan 1950).

title: Battle of Plassey
description: The British East India Company defeated the Nawab of Bengal and his French allies, marking a key step in British rule in India.

title: French Revolution begins (Storming of the Bastille)
description: Parisians stormed the Bastille prison, a symbol of royal authority.
